definition: to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
to take over by force/to rob/to plunder/to brush over/to skim/to sweep
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Winds flying through the fingers, I sigh deeply at my old image in the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 風從指間掠過，我對鏡中的自己感慨良久。

sentences.english: A school of spotted eagle rays glides gracefully through the island-speckled waters of the Maldives.
sentences.chinese: 一羣斑點鷹魟姿態優雅的掠過馬爾代夫羣島水域。

sentences.english: A string skims across the sky.
Over the green and yellow rice-fields sweep the shadows of the autumn clouds followed by the swift chasing sun.
sentences.chinese: 黃綠的稻田上掠過秋雲的陰影，後面是狂追的太陽。

sentences.english: Sweet fancies flitted through his mind.
sentences.chinese: 甜蜜的幻想掠過他的腦際。

sentences.english: Thoughts pass in my mind like swallows of lucks in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 思想掠過我的心上，有如一羣野燕飛過天空。

sentences.english: The plane just brushed the surface of the sea.
She could hear nothing but the waves and the seagulls flying up above in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 耳邊的海浪聲和海鷗掠過天空的聲音讓她陶醉。

sentences.english: Dimly morning breeze, faint twilight light, passing always have your companionship.
sentences.chinese: 依稀晨風，依稀暮光，掠過的總是有你的陪伴。

sentences.english: He moved his shield quickly, and the sword glanced off.
sentences.chinese: 他迅速移動盾牌，於是劍掠過了盾牌。

sentences.english: The Hellcats sprang just as something brushed past him and he felt himself struck from above and behind.
sentences.chinese: 地獄貓撲了過來，他感到身後有東西從上方掠過。

sentences.english: When the white doves flew past, they struck the bells with their wings and made them tinkle.
sentences.chinese: 每當白鴿飛過，翅膀掠過鈴鐺，便叮鈴作響。

sentences.english: The swans were knifing the sky.
Occasionally could be heard the drone of an unmolested 'plane.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾能聽到飛機掠過的聲音。

sentences.english: Others, more active, rose in flocks and passed in clouds over their heads.
sentences.chinese: 比較靈活的鳥成羣地象雲似的從他們頭上掠過。

definition: to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
continuous/unbroken/uninterrupted/extending forever into the distance (of mountain range, river etc)
to appear before one's eyes/to come into view/to float into appearance/to come back (of images from the past)/to emerge/it emerges/it occurs (to me that..)
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
